WRITING.TEXT: Thanks man!
Haha thank you!
Thanks!
Thank you!
And a few other things :P
yes
Sumo/Rooster/chicken deer maybe, not entirely sure myself :P
Thank you, yes this is my work and I am a tattoo artist but these kind of designs are not aimed to be tattoos.
Thanks man :D

Since I started doing these 4-5 years ago I just called it Sketches Coffee, (nr) - Vol.(nr) So no not really any name. Its sort of just hatch shading that is the base for this and then the rest is all me.
Thanks man!, Well I am a tattoo artist but I live in Japan. This style is not really made for tattoos though.
Pretty much, Its like a weird hybrid of water colour and markers. Plus people aaaaalways ask what stuff I use in particular so I am trying to save myself some time here ;)

I guess this is sort of a test of the new rules... I don't remember if this was in the rules before but, No extraneous objects in frame? No desk? Personally I think it's important to show that it's a drawing made in a sketchbook and that you can see sort of how big it is and in its natural environment. Also this way it's not misstaken for digital art as easily. Anyways, I hope you like it and if it breaks the rules I guess thats that :P
It took longer then 7 days but it's up now! Shipping cost is s bitch tho :/ Www.deadpigeon.bigcartel.com
It's online again! But shipping cost is 20$... www.Deadpigeon.bigcartel.com
Thanks man, That means a lot to me. I mean personally I don't even see my drawings as creepy, I see them more as a balance between dark and bright, not to much of either.
Yupp!

Haha, glad somebody got it :) I sell prints of my drawings, so if you are in Tokyo and just tell me in advance I can prepare the prints for you and you just come to the tattoo studio where I work. I dont really drink much anymore haha, I don't have time to be hungover :P
Thank you! But I am drawing like a crazy person already haha :D
Haha thanks and congratulations on 9600, I will drink a beer in your honor tonight!
Thank you, Book a flight to Tokyo and I can tattoo you ;)
Wihoo!

There is really nothing to see, I just sit down with a ballpoint pen and a blank paper and start drawing. If you draw a portrait or an animal or anything like that there are techniques to do so and make it look realistic, this is another way of drawing. I have an old video of me doing that but it would gain you nothing to see it.
Thank you!
Yes, you just need to go to Bookia in Sweden and buy them in the store. You can't buy them online.
Thank you, This in particular maybe 4 hours and a lifetime of practice ;)
Copic markers and ballpoint pens
That would be great :)
Yea, I didn't mean for it but yea it was probably influencing me, Also the little guy at one of the legs sort of feels like the guy with short arms.
Haha, also sort of funny side note: I live 10 minutes away from the Studio Ghibli museum.
I recently watched that season, it might have been an subconscious influence.
I am a tattoo artist :P
Haha you just got a golden star from me :)

I sort of just draw these drawings on the fly with a ballpoint pen without sketching first so they just end up as they end up. I am never trying to copy anything when I draw. Sometimes things might look similar to something as skeletons are skeletons :)
I have taken my print shop offline at the moment as I am making new prints. There will be some limited editions soon.

More then 500 more ;) https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/
And thank you :)
No magic to it, Copics don't stain each-other
Just a hundred situps and pushups a day for a 100 days.
Omg, please don't, you will regret it forever.
Might need to be made a little bit more child friendly but yes, I could totally see that.
Im not sure I would be able to make a tutorial on this to be honest.
Thanks man!
Thank you :) Personally I think the quality come in waves, I just got to keep on drawing and eventually I hit a good vein and voila.
When I drew this I thought to myself, "thiiiis, thiiis reminds me of something" and then I thought about spirited away haha.

Thank you, Nothing inspired me to start drawing, it sort of just happened as soon as I figured out how pens worked at a very young age. However then I just kept on drawing pretty much until I found my style. I did write about how I came up with my style and things around that in a blog a couple of years ago, I gave up on it quickly though. But I think it might answer all your questions. Part 1 and part 2 are not in a continuous order but they are named part 1 and part 2 so if you just scroll a little ;) http://skoffee.blogspot.jp
I am happy to be a dude this very moment. I'm sorry that we and our magic wands turn you into this.
Haha thank you on the signature. I mostly use it to blend colour pencils instead of using water ;)

The one I use is from a office supply company in Sweden. When I run out I have to ask one of my sisters to send me some to Japan. I really like them but they are probably far from perfect. Also I want to keep my series in the same type of sketchbook.
Thank you :)
It would be a cool project and I have a feeling that it might happen at some point :)
The second pinup warbird thingy I guess haha :) By now I am a lot of different pictures to different people ;)

I have the blending pen but I never use it with other copics.
Hello and Thank you! You better book many trips to Japan if you want a whole sleave ;)
Thank you!
Thank you, I get many requests to do so but I never have enough time.
Hello, yes it's mine, I did it an hour ago. No sorry I don't have an Etsy
